metadata.dc:author: Pérez Leiros, P
Calvo Gómez, C
Justo Firvida, E
Cinos Ramos, L
Lado Lado, F L
metadata.dc:description: In this open study, 210 patients from both sexes, age above 60 years and diagnosis of AHT, were included. All patients were treated, following the washing-out phase, with a calcium antagonist dihydropyridine: nicardipine, at a doses of 60 mg/day for 12 weeks. A significant reduction in SAP (from 168.97 to 152.25 mm Hg.) and DAP (from 98.17 to 87.63 mm Hg.) was observed, without modifications in the cardiac rate. In addition, a low incidence of adverse effects and a high biological tolerance of the drug has been demonstrated during the whole study.
metadata.dc:title: Eficacia de la nicardipina en el tratamiento de la hipertensión arterial en pacientes ancianos. Estudio multicéntrico en régimen de ambulatorio.
[The efficacy of nicardipine in treating arterial hypertension in elderly patients. A multicenter outpatient study].
